user_message:
<misra_rule>
The target MISRA C 2023 Rule 1.2 is: Language extensions should not be used.
You should report only when the code uses any language compiler extensions that are explicitly stated as an extension in compiler documentations.
</misra_rule>
<instruction>
Other agents will judge whether the code follows the MISRA C 2023 guidelines.
They will investigate the code fragments you give.
Your job is to find code fragments in the code that should be investigated to check whether the code follows the MISRA C rule.
</instruction>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- suspicious_frags: The list of suspicious code fragments in the code.
It should contain only the code fragments exists in the code. If you do not find any suspicious code fragments, return an empty list for suspicious_frags
- explanation: The explanation of why other code fragments should NOT be investigated.
It is very important to not miss any suspicious code fragments, so please give a sufficient explanation why other code fragments should not be investigated.
DO NOT give any explanation for the selected suspicious code fragments.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_special_api_:
```c
static int
mhd_tool_get_sys_cpu_count_special_api_ (void)
{
  int ret = -1;
#ifdef HAVE_PSTAT_GETDYNAMIC
  if (0 >= ret)
  {
    /* HP-UX things */
    struct pst_dynamic psd_data;
    memset ((void *) &psd_data, 0, sizeof (psd_data));
    if (1 == pstat_getdynamic (&psd_data, sizeof (psd_data), (size_t) 1, 0))
    {
      if (0 < psd_data.psd_proc_cnt)
        ret = (int) psd_data.psd_proc_cnt;
    }
  }
#endif /* HAVE_PSTAT_GETDYNAMIC */
#ifdef HAVE_VXCPUENABLEDGET
  if (0 >= ret)
  {
    /* VxWorks */
    cpuset_t enb_set;
    enb_set = vxCpuEnabledGet ();
    /* Count set bits */
    for (ret = 0; 0 != enb_set; enb_set &= enb_set - 1)
      ++ret;
  }
#endif /* HAVE_VXCPUENABLEDGET */
#if defined(_WIN32) && ! defined (__CYGWIN__)
  if (0 >= ret)
  {
    /* Native W32 */
    HMODULE k32hndl;
    k32hndl = LoadLibraryA ("kernel32.dll");
    if (NULL != k32hndl)
    {
      typedef DWORD (WINAPI *GAPC_PTR)(WORD GroupNumber);
      GAPC_PTR ptrGetActiveProcessorCount;
      /* Available on W7 or later */
      ptrGetActiveProcessorCount =
        (GAPC_PTR) (void *) GetProcAddress (k32hndl, "GetActiveProcessorCount");
      if (NULL != ptrGetActiveProcessorCount)
      {
        DWORD res;
        res = ptrGetActiveProcessorCount (ALL_PROCESSOR_GROUPS);
        ret = (int) res;
        if (res != (DWORD) ret)
          ret = -1; /* Overflow */
      }
    }
    if ((0 >= ret) && (NULL != k32hndl))
    {
      typedef void (WINAPI *GNSI_PTR)(SYSTEM_INFO *pSysInfo);
      GNSI_PTR ptrGetNativeSystemInfo;
      /* May give incorrect (low) result on versions from W7 to W11
         when more then 64 CPUs are available */
      ptrGetNativeSystemInfo =
        (GNSI_PTR) (void *) GetProcAddress (k32hndl, "GetNativeSystemInfo");
      if (NULL != ptrGetNativeSystemInfo)
      {
        SYSTEM_INFO sysInfo;

        memset ((void *) &sysInfo, 0, sizeof (sysInfo));
        ptrGetNativeSystemInfo (&sysInfo);
        ret = (int) sysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors;
        if (sysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors != (DWORD) ret)
          ret = -1; /* Overflow */
      }
    }
    if (NULL != k32hndl)
      FreeLibrary (k32hndl);
  }
  if (0 >= ret)
  {
    /* May give incorrect (low) result on versions from W7 to W11
       when more then 64 CPUs are available */
    SYSTEM_INFO sysInfo;
    memset ((void *) &sysInfo, 0, sizeof (sysInfo));
    GetSystemInfo (&sysInfo);
    ret = (int) sysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors;
    if (sysInfo.dwNumberOfProcessors != (DWORD) ret)
      ret = -1; /* Overflow */
  }
#endif /* _WIN32 && ! __CYGWIN__ */
  if (0 >= ret)
    return -1;
  return ret;
}
```
</target_code>
Please find suspicious code fragments in the code and report them. Other agents can not investigate other fragments that you do not report, so it is very important to find all suspicious fragments without missing any. Report the suspicious fragments AS MUCH AS POSSIBLE.
explanation: Other parts of the function are platform-API usage or standard C constructs and do not, by themselves, represent compiler language extensions that must be reported for MISRA C Rule 1.2. Examples: the use of platform types (HMODULE, DWORD, SYSTEM_INFO, cpuset_t, struct pst_dynamic) and calls to OS/library functions (LoadLibraryA, FreeLibrary, GetSystemInfo, pstat_getdynamic, vxCpuEnabledGet, etc.) are API/OS-specific but not language extensions. Standard casts to (void *) for data-pointer usage, memset calls, preprocessor conditionals (#ifdef/#if), the for-loop used to count set bits, and integer conversions/casts are standard C behavior (though portability or correctness may still need review, they are not compiler language extensions per se). The fragments selected are the places where compiler-specific calling-convention macros (WINAPI) and casting of the result of GetProcAddress through (void *) to function-pointer types appear; these are commonly implemented as compiler extensions and therefore need investigation under Rule 1.2.
